content: Hello all! Here's the thread for Michael Robinson's talk, "Assignments to sheaves of pseudometric spaces".
Please note the change in time! This week, and only this week, the talk will be at 2 pm EDT (Boston time).

Zoom meeting:
https://mit.zoom.us/j/280120646
Meeting ID: 280 120 646

Youtube live stream:
https://youtu.be/9PVk-CxUtYw
You mentioned the "distance" between an assignment and a global secton. Are you just taking like the product metric to give a sensible notion of distance between assignments?
The construction you're giving for CoarseFilt feels a little bit like taking the nerve of PartCover. Is there a nicer way of expressing that connection?

Thanks for the talk. My dad is very into ham radio, and I think he'd really like the foxhunting example (he doesn't actually understand any math that I do, but he likes trying to). I'll see if I can explain it to him
